preqs: Students must have passed one of ECW1101 or ECG1101 and one of ECG2730 or ECS2730 or ECW2730 before undertaking this unit.

rules.ruleString: Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECB3143, ECS3143, ECW3143}

(Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ECB1101, ECF1100, ECG1101, ECP1100, ECW1101} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} and  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ECG2120, ECG2730, ECW2120, ECW2730} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})
Must be enrolled in course type {10, 41, 50}

description: This unit is designed to analyse the effect of money on key economic variables such as interest rates, inflation, output, and on the workings of the banking sector. In addition, the unit examines the roles played by commercial banks and the Central Bank in the process of money creation and the implementation of monetary policy. The unit uses an economic approach to allow analysis of policy decisions.
